sub_topic: Identifying the automorphism group of a graph.
message_1:
Consider the graph below:

![graph image](https://i.imgur.com/dRREhxz.png)

What is the automorphism group of this graph?
message_2:
An automorphism of a graph is a permutation of its vertices that preserves adjacency. The automorphism group of a graph is the set of all its automorphisms.

In the given graph, we can observe the following automorphisms:

1. Identity: Keep all vertices in their original positions.
2. Rotation by 120 degrees clockwise: A -> B, B -> C, C -> A, D -> E, E -> F, F -> D.
3. Rotation by 240 degrees clockwise: A -> C, B -> A, C -> B, D -> F, E -> D, F -> E.

These are the only automorphisms that preserve adjacency in the given graph. Therefore, the automorphism group of this graph has 3 elements, and can be represented as {Identity, Rotation by 120 degrees, Rotation by 240 degrees}.
